Insists Babitch get dressed and go with him despite Babitch's suspicion, showing insistence on helping.
Shows terse, harsh response 'Shut up' to Babitch's doubt.
Comes to get Bill and Cindy, wants to bring Bill in safely and asks Glynn to come along, emphasizing community and a way out for everyone.
Enters tavern, causing all conversation to stop; pushes out cigarette, indicating assertiveness but no hostility.
Freddy moves slowly and steadily toward a tense situation, maintaining composure and lighting a cigarette, demonstrating calmness under pressure.
Freddy decisively enters the tavern, commands attention by making conversations stop, and engages directly with key individuals to communicate his intentions clearly.
Freddy reveals he found Bill and asserts the plan to bring him in, showing initiative and responsibility for resolving the situation.
Freddy tries to negotiate a collective surrender to prevent violence, indicating strategic thinking and leadership.
Freddy ignores Babitch’s pleas and leaves abruptly, which could be seen as a lack of sensitivity or teamwork.
Urges Glynn and others to come in together and straighten out the corruption legally and as a community.
Acknowledges Glynn's difficult position and does not demonize him, showing understanding.
Wipes sweat from his brow while under pressure, indicating vulnerability but perseverance.
Shakes his head silently, possibly showing doubt or resignation.
Attempts to negotiate and bring others together to solve the town's problems legally and collectively.
Wipes sweat from brow, seems uncertain or pressured during confrontation.
Responds calmly to accusations and tries to reason with Glynn about cleaning up the town despite limitations.
Fails to assert himself fully under Glynn’s pressure and shakes his head in frustration.
Expresses dissatisfaction with the corruption in the town and a desire to 'set things right'
Maintains silence and restraint when pressured aggressively by Glynn and others
Places his hand near his holster causing discomfort for Cindy, showing tension or potential for escalation
Tears well in his eyes when discussing guiding traffic through town, showing emotional sensitivity.
Invites Glynn to leave with him, offering companionship despite uncertainty.
Smiles reassuringly at Bill to ease tension despite dangerous circumstances.
Sends Bill home to take care of his pregnant wife, showing consideration for others' needs.
Calmly sets and communicates a clear plan to leave at six, inviting Ray to come with him, demonstrating leadership and resolve.
Shows emotional vulnerability by tearing up, indicating emotional conflict but does not let it paralyze him.
Despite tense circumstances, maintains composure when faced with Glynn’s manipulation and the tension in the room, ultimately securing agreement on his terms.
Slumps facing the windows, appearing resigned and emotionally burdened, potentially indicating self-doubt or lack of immediate agency.
Displays confidence in reassuring Bill he will be fine and that threats are unavoidable but he will survive, showing mental toughness.
Takes no immediate physical action to change the situation despite implied danger and the IDLING car outside, possibly indicating hesitation or acceptance.
Freddy wakes up alert, checks outside quietly, takes a shotgun and frees Babitch from a cell to leave together, showing concern for his colleague's well-being.
When confronted and threatened by Cotter with a gun to his head, Freddy pleads calmly, 'Jesus. Guys. You don't want to do this...,' showing a desire to de-escalate conflict and maintain peace.
Wakes up on time, prepares by taking a shotgun, and frees Babitch from the cell to leave promptly.
Fails to notice the sabotage to his squad car (tires slashed) until he reaches it, leaving him vulnerable to an ambush.
Attempts to verbally de-escalate the situation when threatened at gunpoint, indicating presence of mind.
Gets subdued and forced down to his knees without resistance or an attempt to regain control or avoid capture.
Begins pleading for reason to avoid violence ('Jesus. Guys. You don't want to do this.')
Shows resilience and stubbornness despite severe injury (shot, bleeding, yet struggles to stand and continues moving forward)
Appears isolated and possibly betrayed, as other cops ignore or avoid him when severely wounded (cop closes door)
Closes his eyes and endures a gunshot near his head without panicking or losing presence of mind.
Rolls to the pavement after the gunshot, despite severe injury, showing physical resilience.
Struggles to stand and continues moving while injured and bleeding, armed and determined.
Stumbling painfully up the road, showing determination but some physical limitation due to injury.
His eyes are glazed and face stone, potentially indicating emotional overwhelm or tunnel vision.
Marches dazed and bloody toward armed adversaries, steady and unflinching despite injury
Marches forward dazed and bloody toward armed adversaries with a shotgun in hand, showing steadiness and not flinching when shot at point-blank range.
Fires repeatedly at antagonists in a hostile gunfight, walking steadily and calmly despite being under fire and wounded.
Raises gun and fires silently, hits targets effectively, continues moving steadily despite being shot, neutralizes threats one by one.
Appears oblivious to Liz's silent screams and his own injury until he notices the blood, indicating possible lack of immediate situational awareness.
Returns fire to protect himself and others during a violent confrontation, carefully following a blood trail to check on wounded individuals.
Shows determination and concern by moving through a dangerous scene and attempting to understand the situation despite his own injuries and confusion.
Accurately fires and hits Lagonda first before Lagonda can shoot again.
Dazed momentarily but quickly returns fire during the ambush, showing presence of mind under fire.
Follows a bloody trail carefully and cautiously through the house, indicating attention to detail and investigation skills.
Despite being surrounded and under pressure, maintains gun trained on threats and takes quick, decisive action.
In the moment of confrontation, notices the blood trail and uses it to anticipate danger, showing situational awareness.
Unable to hear Ray Glynn as he lunges, indicating a potential gap in communication or situational control.
Drags wounded Babitch to safety despite his own severe injury, calmly pays toll while bleeding.
Shares a weary smile with Figs, showing camaraderie and resilience.
Drives a car despite having a serious gunshot wound, able to follow directions to pass through the toll booth, maintaining some control and composure.
Appears confused about the toll price and payment due to deafness and injury, momentarily unable to understand the toll taker.
